race_name: British EBF Future Stayers' Novice Stakes (Sire & Dam Restricted Race) (Plus 10) (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Blue Courvoisier
runners.comment: Tidy winner on 7f debut 21 days ago; surely more to offer and 1m can suit; big player
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling; dam and three half-brothers were winning sprinters but this colt is by Sea The Stars and he looked better the further he went when running out a tidy winner on debut at Leicester (7f, good; 6-1) three weeks ago; appeals quite strongly as the type who has more to offer and this step up in trip promises to suit too.

runners.name: Item
runners.comment: Well backed and impressive on debut; Group 1 entry; could be anything; turf debut.
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt; 5-2 from 11-2 and drew clear impressively on his introduction at Kempton (7f, AW) four weeks ago; holds a Group 1 Doncaster Futurity entry and could be anything; turf debut.

runners.name: Ibn Sirin
runners.comment: Too green when 16-1 and beaten 23l on debut; big step forward required
runners.spotlight: 65,000gns yearling; too green to do himself justice when 16-1 and beaten 23l in Goodwood novice (1m, good to firm) last month; will need to take a huge step forward from that debut.

runners.name: Three Builders
runners.comment: Last of ten at Ffos Las (7.5f, good) on his introduction; one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: 40,000euros breeze-up buy in May; 33-1 and played up in the preliminaries before finishing last of ten at Ffos Las (7.5f, good) on his introduction last month; likely one for further down the line.

runners.name: Annastarzy
runners.comment: Form case at the weights but likely got her work cut out against the two penalty carriers
runners.spotlight: Out of a really likeable mare who did well for these connections; respectable efforts in 1m maiden and novice (soft/good) this month; having her third quick qualifying run and, while a form case can be justified at the weights, she's likely got her work cut out against the two penalty carriers.

runners.name: King Of Stars
runners.comment: Two good runs prior to moderate effort latest; tempting on drop in grade
runners.spotlight: 1-1 over C&D; two good efforts since returning from latest seven-month absence but ran moderately when twelfth of 14 at York last time; 11l margin of defeat does him some disservice though (squeezed out then eased) and this drop in grade can help him bounce back; easiest task on turf for years; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: He did very well last year when winning four races, but having started out on 75 he shot up to 104. It seemed a good idea at the time to send him out to Meydan over the winter but things did not really work out for him there, which was a shame. He was on the go for quite a while so we are giving him a break now and he will be back on turf, when the ground gets quicker as he is far more effective with top of the ground conditions. We will be looking to the big 5f sprints with him and hope that we can continue to find improvement up to at least Listed level. I would think we would be looking to May before he is back in action. 22-03-22

runners.name: Star Chorus
runners.comment: Said to be suited by Southwell when winning AW h'cap last week; 6lb penalty back on turf
runners.spotlight: Won four-runner Chepstow handicap (good to firm; hood and tongue-tie) in July and back on the scoresheet when picking up AW handicap (also 5f) one week ago; was said to be suited by the return to Southwell that day and has a 6lb penalty to deal with back on turf.

runners.name: Kinetic Force
runners.comment: Impressive over C&D in April; may be running better than it looks of late; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Impressive over C&D (good to firm; first-time tongue-tie) in April; second at Yarmouth (5f, good to firm) in August and has probably been running better than it looks in three starts this month, latterly when not staying 6f ten days ago; might surprise a few.

runners.name: Cressida Wildes
runners.comment: Off since winning six-runner handicap in July; bled that day; 5lb rise looks stiff enough
runners.spotlight: Patchy form since getting off the mark in three-runner AW novice in January but she doubled her tally when landing a six-runner Yarmouth handicap (also 5f, good) in July; bled that day and off since, while the 5lb rise looks stiff enough.

runners.name: Jax Edge
runners.comment: Due reward for near misses with win (6f, good to firm) last month; on the premises again
runners.spotlight: Ended her 2024 campaign with two AW wins and gained due reward for a series of near misses when battling on well for narrow win in Windsor handicap (6f, good to firm) last month; on the premises again.

quotes.race: Extra Place Races At Fitzdares.com Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Jax Edge was in front far too early but it was a brave, topweight-carrying performance - Gina Mangan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Moes Legacy
runners.comment: Won four from last seven; respectable on easy ground lately; firmly in the picture
runners.spotlight: In good form over the summer and she landed a fast-ground hat-trick when winning here (5.5f) at the start of August; went in again over that C&D (firm) a fortnight later and two respectable efforts (soft/heavy) subsequently; forecast quicker conditions bring her right back into the picture.

runners.name: Diamond Dreamer
runners.comment: Absent since 6th (5f, good) in June; same mark and suspicion he's ideally suited by AW
runners.spotlight: Sole turf success came at Lingfield (5f, good to soft) last August; absent since finishing sixth of 11 at Sandown (5f, good) in June; same mark and suspicion he's ideally suited by AW.

runners.name: Hk Fourteen
runners.comment: Largely progressive; career best latest; no reason to think his improvement has plateaued
runners.spotlight: Largely progressive this year and he followed wins at Windsor (good) in July and Newbury (good to firm; Aces Wild second) in August with a career-best third in blanket finish at Doncaster (also 5f, soft; first-time cheekpieces) 16 days ago; no reason to think his improvement has plateaued.

quotes.race: DragonBet - Born From The Betting Ring Handicap
quotes.quote: HK Fourteen has just been learning his trade. He's a big horse with a nice pedigree and he's not been rushed. We've taken it one step at a time. We're very pleased with him. He looked like being a seven furlong horse or a miler but the more we ran him, the less it looked likely. He's a lovely horse and I think he can go on as we're hoping to go on the all-weather with him now - Tony Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: Aces Wild
runners.comment: Won in July and second (also 5f, good to firm) last month; each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: Usually seen at a lower level but he comes here in good form, winning at Chester (good) in July and second at Newbury (also 5f, good to firm) last month; another 2lb higher but holds each-way claims again.

quotes.race: Halliwell Jones Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Finley's [Marsh] given Aces Wild a fantastic ride and it's great to see him doing well. The horse deserved it. He'd been unlucky as we'd been chasing pots on the AW and things just hadn't fallen right. The track was a bit of a question mark but he's done well around tight tracks on the AW, so we thought it was worth a try - and it's paid off. Our horses are coming back into great form now and he ran well last time, so I'm glad to see him win - Adrian Wintle, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Aces Wild is a fast little horse and he's lightly raced and those kind of sprinters improve with age. We are hopeful he will keep the ball rolling - John McConnell, trainer

runners.name: Over Spiced
runners.comment: Third win of the season (5f) three weeks ago; up 4lb in a better race but she's hardy
runners.spotlight: Consistent on a sound surface since two wins in May and she won her third race of the season when bagging a Leicester handicap (also 5f) three weeks ago; more to do up 4lb in a better race but she's hardy.

runners.name: Rajeteriat
runners.comment: Beaten a total of one rival in three starts for new yard; would be a surprise winner
runners.spotlight: Has beaten a total of one rival in three starts for his new yard and it would be a surprise if he staged a revival in this competitive affair.

race_name: BetWright Bet The Wright Way Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Sant Alessio
runners.comment: 6lb higher than for his 1m win here but did that readily and stays beyond this trip
runners.spotlight: Off the mark for his current yard over 1m here in August (firm); up 6lb but he scored readily there so is not taken lightly; stays 1m4f.

runners.name: Annexation

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late S F Hui

runners.comment: 0-14 for new stable this year but has run well in defeat, though not last time on the AW
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; 0-14 for new stable this year but has run well in defeat, though not last time on the AW; others preferred.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Annexation missed the beat a bit and it was ideal as I had something to aim at the whole way. I think this is his ideal trip and he could win another one up here - Chris Hayes, rider

stable_tour.quote: He was really good at Navan in his maiden hurdle and we were aiming for the novice hurdle at Tipperary but he wasn't right. He seems in good form again and we might aim him at the For Auction Novice Hurdle at Navan. He handled soft ground on the Flat, although whether he'll be as effective on it over hurdles we'll see. We'll feel our way with him in the autumn and if he handles soft ground we can plot our way through the winter with him. 09-11-20

runners.name: Stipulation
runners.owner: Horn And Trumpet Lads & S & A Mares
runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo won has won narrowly at Yarmouth (1m2f) and Wolverhampton (9.4f)
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who has won narrowly at Yarmouth (1m2f) and Wolverhampton (9.4f); edging up the weights but something has clicked.

runners.name: Spec Of Light
runners.owner: R G Robinson & R D Robinson
runners.comment: Got up late on at Southwell in March (1m) but ran poorly after a break at Windsor
runners.spotlight: Got up late on at Southwell in March (1m) but ran poorly after a break at Windsor and now returns from another stretch on the sidelines; having only his second run on turf.

runners.name: Dragonflame
runners.comment: Consistent in handicaps and finished his race out well for second at Kempton (1m)
runners.spotlight: No wins in seven but consistent in handicaps and finished his race out well for second at Kempton (1m); return to 1m2f is worth exploring.

runners.name: In The Post
runners.comment: Not beaten far in two of his three races and now enters handicaps
runners.spotlight: Beaten 14l in his second run (1m4f) but a lot closer on either side of that (7f/1m) and now enters handicaps; may have more to offer.

runners.name: Twilight Moon
runners.comment: Dual winner this summer but progress has stalled and she's back in distance here
runners.spotlight: Two 1m4f wins this summer (latest off 2lb lower) but progress has stalled and she's back in distance here.

runners.name: Jodhpur Blue
runners.comment: AW maiden winner but beat only two rivals this season across his first four handicaps
runners.spotlight: Won 7f AW maiden last October for Charlie Hills but beat only two rivals this season across his first four handicaps; going beyond 1m for first time.

runners.name: Bownder
runners.comment: Capable handicapper; didn't get home over 1m3f last time after racing keenly
runners.spotlight: Won at Goodwood (1m2f, good) in June and respectable runs in the meantime; didn't get home over 1m3f last time after racing keenly in first-time cheekpieces; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He won a Goodwood handicap in June off 66 and went to Newbury on Friday for a 1m2f apprentice handicap, finishing a half-length second with five lengths back to the third. It was a good run off a mark of 68. He's a reliable sort whose best distance is a mile and a quarter and he'll keep going as long as there's some give in the ground. 20-08-25

runners.name: Calibos

prev_owners.owner: M & M Racing, Paul Byrne And Partner

runners.comment: Below par tried in a visor last time but the blinkers are soon back on; form contender
runners.spotlight: Below par tried in a visor last time but the blinkers are soon back on and this Windsor winner (1m2f, good to firm) was close up at Newmarket the time before; considered.

stable_tour.quote: He has improved for a step up in trip and ran into one of Sir Mark Prescott's called Deep Water Bay at Wolverhampton the other day. He's physically developed and he'll improve as the season goes on. There's lots of fun to be had for the Fellowship Racing and Diskovery syndicate. 11-06-25

runners.name: Tap Dancer
runners.breeder: Minster Stud And Mrs H Dalgety
runners.comment: Quiet runs this season leaves her with questions to answer but ability is respected
runners.spotlight: Won an uncompetitive novice over C&D last October (heavy) and wasn't beaten far in a handicap here next time; quiet runs this season leaves her with questions to answer but ability is respected.

runners.name: San Francisco Bay
runners.comment: Collared late on by a 3yo at Lingfield last time (AW); has form here and should run well
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who stayed there over 1m2f at Nottingham in July and only collared late on by a 3yo at Lingfield last time (AW); has form here and should run well.

stable_tour.quote: Of all my juveniles this colt has probably done the most work as he is so straightforward and physically in a good place. He will want 6f to start off and I would think he will be ready to run a big race first time out. He will run before Royal Ascot and that will tell us whether he is good enough for that royal meeting. 21-04-21

runners.name: Favourbrook
runners.comment: Unexposed and beaten under 3l on handicap debut here a month ago (1m, heavy)
runners.spotlight: Unexposed and beaten under 3l on handicap debut here a month ago (1m, heavy); different conditions and a longer trip to deal with now but not dismissed.

runners.name: Blue Hero

prev_owners.owner: K Sohi Mrs I Corbani & Partners

runners.comment: All nine wins have been here and slow ground not ideal on his last two visits
runners.spotlight: All nine wins have been here and slow ground not ideal on his last two visits; has a competitive show in him off this mark.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I was expecting a good performance from Blue Hero, although the trip was a question mark. We thought he'd get it, but he's improved from a three-year-old. He's a little bit tricky in his head, but he's physically improved from last year. He likes it here, but doesn't have to stay here - it's coincidence we run a lot here. I was worried the ground would be on the soft side, but he's handled it well - Adrian Wintle, trainer.

runners.name: The Thames Boatman
runners.comment: Last win over a year ago but has been runner-up six times subsequently; respected
runners.spotlight: Can fluff the start; last win over a year ago but has been runner-up six times subsequently, including here (5f, good to firm) in April; also finished second on AW last time and he's respected off this lower turf mark.

quotes.race: It's Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: The Thames Boatman needs pace in his races and looking at this race beforehand I knew he'd get that today, so that was an advantage. He's at his best when he has something to aim at, but he made life harder for himself by hanging in the last half a furlong. We do think he's a smart horse, especially on the all-weather - Finley Marsh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was brilliant at Lingfield on Saturday, taking his record at the track to 3-3. He just got there over 5f and we might see an ounce of improvement if we go to 6f. He loves Lingfield, so we'll probably stick to there for now. 18-09-24

runners.name: Lipsink
runners.comment: Won (5f, soft) one month ago but didn't back that up next time; still considered
runners.spotlight: Just nabbed by Treacherous over C&D (good to firm) last August and won an AW handicap in November; back on the scoresheet when winning at Sandown (also 5f, soft) one month ago but didn't back that up next time; still considered.

quotes.race: Discover Whats Trending At Rhino.Bet Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a bit of a surprise. We thought Lipsink needed that badly today which he probably did so he's going to come on a lot. He's a nice horse. He's in here again next week and we'll probably bring him back - Mick Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Strike
runners.breeder: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.owner: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.comment: Beaten a neck last time; also finished second on his two tries over C&D; respected
runners.spotlight: Won off this mark at Windsor (good to firm) last July and got over a couple of blips when beaten a neck back at that track (also 6f, good) last time; also finished second on his two tries over C&D; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He ran in the Grey Horse Handicap at Newmarket on Saturday. It's a race he has won before and the owners wanted to win it again but it was a strong renewal and he could only manage midfield. The ground had been watered too, which didn't help. He's getting on in years and his handicap mark is dropping as he gets older. But he's a dear friend of the yard and a joy to have around. He's thoroughly genuine and may turn out at Windsor on Saturday. 20-08-25

runners.name: On Edge
runners.comment: Just failed in 14-runner handicap 8 days ago; big player on that; potential ground query
runners.spotlight: His knocks on the door are getting louder and just failed to land a 14-runner Leicester handicap (6f, good to soft) eight days ago; big player on that although he disappointed on good to firm in July when said to prefer a slower surface.

runners.name: Treacherous
runners.comment: Won over C&D last August and he's slipped to a handy mark; down in grade too
runners.spotlight: Just collared Lipsink over C&D (good to firm) last August and was also running well in the spring; not at the same level in five starts since but he's slipped to a handy mark and comes down in grade; likely there's still life in the old boy.

quotes.race: Unibet Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: Treacherous is a big horse and he's taken time to mature. He's not been over raced considering his age and he would be relatively fragile; he spends most of his time between races swimming. He doesn't do a lot in front either which helps his mark. We might look for a Listed race for him at some point and we'd like to give him a break soon enough as well. I wanted to try him on the turf as I thought he could be at least as good as he is on the all-weather and I'd like to try more on the turf if possible rather than the all-weather - Ed de Giles, trainer.

runners.name: Kiss And Run
runners.comment: C&D winner; shapes like she's building back up after a break; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Good efforts in two starts over C&D include a soft-ground nursery win on this card in 2023; solid second of 17 at Newbury (6f, good) in June and has shaped like she's building back up in three runs after a subsequent break; not ruled out despite a tricky stall.

runners.name: Trafalger
runners.comment: H'cap debut when fifth at Sandown (5f, soft) 18 days ago; remains unexposed
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in novice events at Doncaster (6f, good) and Windsor (5f, good to firm) with a hood for his new stable this summer; hood (absent again) removed for handicap debut when fifth at Sandown (5f, soft) 18 days ago; remains unexposed.

runners.name: Ezra Cee
runners.comment: Promising 3rd on stable debut; excuse latest; tongue-tie and cheekpieces added; player
runners.spotlight: Just nine runs but he's already on his fourth stable; promising start for this one when third at Newmarket (6f, good to firm) in August but again raced freely when not seeing out 7f last time; drop back in trip should help; tongue-tie and cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Danger Alert
runners.comment: Good 2nd (5f, soft) 13 days ago but could do with conditions easing, which isn't forecast
runners.spotlight: Frequent slow starter but has been better in that regard of late; creditable second at Sandown (5f, soft) a fortnight ago but could do with conditions easing, which isn't forecast.

quotes.race: tote £100K Guaranteed Placepot Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Danger Alert has been an enigma. William knows him very well now and he needs to get there late - the interference probably helped him because otherwise he might have got there too soon - and he puts his head up a little - George Boughey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: You cannot fault him this year as he has already won three times, including last time at Chester over 5f. He never does a huge amount at home so is difficult to gauge, but the important thing is he saves his best for the track. He has shown a liking for slower ground, but I don't think quicker going will be a problem as he's a very versatile. I never saw him getting as high as 94, but he is in good shape and his target next week is the Palace of Holyroodhouse Handicap. 14-06-23

runners.name: Spanish Star
runners.comment: Popped up (6f, good to soft) in June; hasn't matched that in four runs since
runners.spotlight: Veteran who popped up at Newbury (6f, good to soft) in June; hasn't matched that in four runs since but is back down to that winning mark; still needs to turn the ship around.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Handicap
quotes.quote: Spanish Star has been unbelievable. He goes on soft ground and quick ground. He is just incredible. We thought he was quite high in the handicap and to be honest he hasn't run well round here before. He has run twice here before with no luck but we thought we would take the gamble and give it another go. He has got to be held up and come in the last half a furlong really. The longer you can hold on to him the better. Rhys (Clutterbuck) got the rail and he was just amazing. A lot of horses we have had have been at their best at six, seven or eight. I think he is better over six furlongs when the ground is very soft but it was quick today and I was worried it was a bit too quick. I think we will probably look at something at Royal Ascot now - Philippa Chamings, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Doom Bar Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Spanish Star has been going so close and finished second ten days ago at Nottingham so it's brilliant to see him win again. He's been a very lucky horse for us but very unlucky at the same time as he was disqualified twice last year, which must be almost unheard of - Shirley Symonds, part-owner.

quotes.race: F45 Bath No Contract Required Handicap
quotes.quote: Spanish Star had a lot of placed form last year without winning and he has obviously improved a bit for his winter break. The race might have fallen apart behind him but he has done well to win - Liam Keniry, rider.

runners.name: Savannah Smiles
runners.comment: Won here (5f, heavy) at the start of this month; latest forgiven; fine on quicker ground
runners.spotlight: Probably best known as a Chepstow regular but looked as good as ever when fending off Secret Handsheikh to win five-runner race here (5f, heavy) at the start of this month; nothing went right from this career-high mark in bid to land a series final over C&D 16 days ago; fine on this forecast quick ground.

quotes.race: In Memory Of Late Sylvia Taylor Handicap
quotes.quote: Savannah Smiles was brilliant and it was a really good win - she's blossomed this year! We bought her last summer and she didn't really do an awful lot, so we gave her a break and she's come back a different horse. She's kept her form all the way through the all-weather and I thought I'd give her another go on the turf and she's never looked back - Grace Harris, trainer.

runners.name: Sioux Warrior
runners.comment: Off the mark (5.5f, good) in May; way off that either side of a break across July & August
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough at Brighton (5.5f, good) in May but way off that either side of a break across July and August; bit to prove now.

runners.name: Secret Handsheikh
runners.comment: Won over C&D (firm) in August; running well on easier ground since; respected again
runners.spotlight: Won his 11th race when scoring over C&D (firm) in August and has been running well on much easier ground since, including when second to progressive 3yo in series final over C&D 16 days ago; respected again.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes Daily Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Secret Handsheikh was a convincing winner last time and went up 9lb but he loves this surface. He skips off the surface and has such a good attitude - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Be An Angel
runners.comment: Won maiden in May; went close off this mark (also 6f, good to firm) last month; considered
runners.spotlight: Finally won her maiden when scoring at Leicester in May; 0-6 in handicaps since but she went close off this mark at Windsor (also 6f, good to firm) last month and didn't get the breaks at Salisbury last time.

stable_tour.quote: You could say she's been a victim of the Great British Bonus scheme, but it's a nice problem to have. To explain, if it's a filly and is British bred, you get a £20,000 bonus for winning a two-year-old fillies' race. So whereas normally you'd give an ordinary horse three runs and go down the handicap route once they'd got the experience, it's such a big bonus that you're getting your fillies really fit for their first three runs, and they've only got to get placed a few times to end up with an inflated handicap mark. I've noticed a lot of fillies are higher up the handicap nowadays than they would have been before the bonus system, and this filly is a prime example. She has been placed several times in bonus races behind good horses and that meant she was a bit high when she started handicapping. But we eventually got our £20,000 bonus, so I'm not complaining too much. 27-08-25

runners.name: South Shore
runners.comment: Won in hood (5.5f, good to firm) in June; second over C&D (good to firm) in August; chance
runners.spotlight: 1lb higher than when scoring in a first-time hood at Wetherby (5.5f, good to firm) in June; twice runner-up since, including over C&D (good to firm) in August; respectable third at Chester (6f, good) eight days ago.

stable_tour.quote: A sprinter who's coming along steadily and I'm taking my time with him because he has ability. He finished down the field at Pontefract on Tuesday but should do better in time. 09-04-25

runners.name: Zoulu Warrior
runners.comment: Patchy form but off the mark (5f, good) last month; this is just his fourth handicap
runners.spotlight: Very patchy form and he was off the mark in six-runner Chepstow handicap (5f, good) last month only to disappoint on AW three weeks ago; this is just his fourth handicap, however, and he's probably capable of better.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A M O'Shea & Sean Delaney

runners.name: Assured
runners.comment: Dropped out to be fifth of seven on her handicap debut at Brighton (1m4f)
runners.spotlight: Dropped out to be fifth of seven on her handicap debut at Brighton (1m4f; 9-1) and not overly convincing after that.

runners.name: Sanitiser
runners.comment: Last win was as a hurdler and has struggled back on the Flat in four runs this season
runners.spotlight: Last win was as a hurdler and has struggled back on the Flat in four runs this season, latterly in a visor; opposable at the minute.

runners.name: Harlington
runners.comment: Always well placed when winning at Wolverhampton ten days ago (1m4f); up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Always well placed when winning at Wolverhampton ten days ago (1m4f); effective on turf and a 3lb rise isn't too damaging.

runners.name: Dalton Park
runners.comment: No closer than 6l in four handicaps from 1m4f to 2m1f, blinkered the last twice
runners.spotlight: No closer than 6l in four handicaps from 1m4f to 2m1f, blinkered the last twice; now in cheekpieces but best trip remains something of a mystery.

runners.name: Jimmy Mark
runners.comment: Poor AW run latest but far more convincing record on turf and had been running well
runners.spotlight: Well behind Harlington on the AW last time but has a far more convincing record on turf and had been running well.

quotes.race: Bresbet Rewards Loyalty Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: They went off at a gallop and Jimmy Mark needs someone to pace make for him and Callum gave him a great ride - Peter Lindsey, owner.

runners.name: Cherry Cola
runners.comment: Last win was over 1m6f here in 2023 but has posted some fair efforts this campaign
runners.spotlight: Last win was over 1m6f here in September 2023 but has posted some fair efforts this campaign; exposed but has each-way claims.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Daily Free Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Cherry Cola was down in grade and likes the track and the ground so things just fell into place for her. Rose Dawes was in the right place on the rail and did it well - Sheena West, trainer.

runners.name: Wilderness

prev_owners.owner: Mrs R Jowett, C R Dunning & Up The Glens

runners.comment: Hasn't won for a good while now and offered very little in her last three races
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won for a good while now and offered very little in her last three races.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Wilderness was in good form coming into today and I thought the step up in trip would probably suit her. She loves bowling away in front and she quickened up well turning into the straight and toughed it out well the last half furlong - Ben Coen, rider

quotes.race: MansionBet's Get Paid As A Winner Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: I had a bad draw but she pinged the gates for me so I let her roll away in front. I kicked turning in and she got a bit lonely in the last furlong on her own but she did it well in the end. If another one came to her [late on] she probably would have gone on, I hope she would have anyway - Ben Coen, rider of Wilderness

runners.name: Hiccups
runners.comment: Beat a Catterick specialist by a neck before second in another small field at Redcar
runners.spotlight: Beat a Catterick specialist by a neck (1m6f, good) before finishing second in another small field at Redcar; thereabouts.

runners.name: Electric Bass
runners.comment: Races prominently; has yet to win but not a lot wrong with his recent efforts; up in trip
runners.spotlight: Races prominently; has yet to win but not a lot wrong with his recent efforts (1m2f-1m3f) and definite chance if staying this longer trip.

runners.name: Buck Barrow
runners.comment: Capable but not exactly a model of consistency and hasn't raced over quite this far
runners.spotlight: Beat Electric Bass over 1m2f at Ffos Las in June and was runner-up back there last month; not exactly a model of consistency and hasn't raced over quite this far.

runners.name: Gregorians Star
runners.comment: Lost his action last time and was pulled up; placed in his two previous races
runners.spotlight: Has only won a bumper; placed at about 1m3f at Lingfield (good to firm) and here (heavy) before losing his action and pulling up 17 days ago; should run well if back in good order.

runners.name: Bobby Dassler
runners.comment: Recent placed efforts here but a hard puller who could be vulnerable over this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Beaten 7l and just over 3l on successive days here earlier this month but those were at 1m3f/1m2f and this hard puller could be vulnerable over this far.

runners.name: Endofastorm
runners.comment: Mostly out of form this summer and she's hard to catch right at the best of times (3-33)
runners.spotlight: Mostly out of form this summer and she's hard to catch right at the best of times (3-33).

runners.name: Its Life
runners.comment: 13-race maiden who has been hurdling and others have more pressing claims back on the Flat
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who has been hurdling and others have more pressing claims back on the Flat.

race_name: Beatwright: Beat The Wright Way Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Thapa Vc
runners.comment: Only 3l away on his final Flat run and that was over 7f; C&D winner
runners.spotlight: Tailed off over hurdles last time but this multiple Flat winner was only 3l away at Doncaster the run before (7f); C&D winner.

quotes.race: Aalberts IPS Pegler Xpress Handicap
quotes.quote: Thapa Vc is quite a tricky ride, he's got to be produced right, and Jim is just class - Mark Rimell, trainer.

runners.name: Silent Flame
runners.comment: Usually consistent but  might just be vulnerable to stronger stays over this stiff 1m
runners.spotlight: Below her best at Brighton last time but had been in a good run of form, as with many from this yard; might just be vulnerable to stronger stays over this stiff 1m.

quotes.race: Peter Britton 60 Years Racing At Salisbury Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Silent Flame is a nice, lovely filly with a good attitude - she'd probably be Al Kazeem's fastest sprinters. She's improving all the time and has thrived this year. She's owned by Gloria Abbey who is very enthusiastic, she's been in the game a long time and is well into her eighties. She knows more about the game than I do - Rod Millman, trainer.

runners.name: Rating
runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: Went down narrowly over 1m2f in July but out the back since then and remains a maiden
runners.spotlight: Went down narrowly over 1m2f in July but out the back since then and remains a maiden.

runners.name: Spirit Of Breeze
runners.comment: The horse he beat at Salisbury has won twice since and jockey can claim his 5lb this time
runners.spotlight: Some lengthy breaks in his profile but won for a second time when a length too good at Salisbury in mid-August (7f, good to firm); 7lb higher but the runner-up won his next two and Ashley Lewis can claim his 5lb this time.

runners.name: Louie The Legend
runners.comment: Won over 1m in July but nowhere near the same level in his last four races
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m in July but nowhere near the same level in his last four races.

runners.name: Dappled Light
runners.comment: C&D winner off a similar mark this summer; faced a tough task last time
runners.spotlight: Followed May's Chepstow win with a C&D success on firm ground and only 1lb higher now; faced a tough task last time.

runners.name: Moonlight Bomb
runners.comment: Shown enough in handicaps to believe his turn will come, including last time
runners.spotlight: Yet to keep his head in front but this looks his trip and he's shown enough in handicaps to believe his turn will come, including last time.

runners.name: On A Vespa
runners.comment: Latest run seemingly confirmed that soft ground isn't for her; won the time before
runners.spotlight: Latest run seemingly confirmed that soft ground isn't for her and had previously won over the extended 7f at Ffos Las on good when in first-time cheekpieces; only 2lb higher here.

runners.name: Weston Court
runners.comment: Back-to-back 1m wins last summer but not in the same form in just three runs this year
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back 1m wins last summer (one here) but not in the same form in just three runs this year; absent three months.

runners.name: Fact Or Fable
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore
runners.comment: Multiple winner but wouldn't be certain to back up his close third here 17 days ago
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner with plenty of form here but his good days are hard to predict and wouldn't be certain to back up his close third here 17 days ago.

stable_tour.quote: I've got two lovely old campaigners who are half-brothers - Fact Or Fable and Uther Pendragon. Between the two of them, they've won just short of £200,000 in prize-money. They always turn up and probably on the days you'd don't expect them to win, they do. They're characters in the yard and keep everybody on their toes who rides them. They're owned by the same people - Wendy and Stuart Jarrett - who get so much fun out of it. It's what the game's about. Wendy and Stuart have point-to-pointers as well and they absolutely love their racing. They come from the Bath area and that's why, when you see them, they'll always turn up at Bath and Chepstow. They're the sort of owners racing needs, who are in it just for the love of the sport. 04-07-24

runners.name: Perfect Parole
runners.comment: Soft no good last time but previous fourth on stable debut was in a classified race
runners.spotlight: Didn't look in love with soft ground at Brighton two weeks ago but his fourth on stable debut was in a classified race; others safer.

runners.name: Wojtek
runners.comment: Beaten 17l on nursery debut but heavy ground a legitimate excuse; first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Second to none other than Zavateri on his introduction at Salisbury (good to firm) in June; not matched that since and was beaten 17l when favourite for his nursery debut at Ffos Las (also 6f, heavy) three weeks ago; conditions a legitimate excuse that day and now swaps blinkers for cheekpieces.

runners.name: Eclipser
runners.comment: Hasn't kicked on from winning AW maiden in June; disappointed in a nursery last time
runners.spotlight: Hasn't kicked on from winning a Chelmsford AW maiden in June and disappointed when seventh of nine in a Nottingham nursery (also 6f, good to firm) eight weeks ago.

runners.name: Tamather
runners.comment: Back from break with disappointing nursery debut 24 days ago; may build on that; needs to
runners.spotlight: Gelded after three qualifying runs; back from a 122 day-break with disappointing eighth of nine in Wolverhampton nursery (5f, AW) earlier this month; may build on that but certainly needs to.

runners.name: White Island
runners.comment: Close second here (5f, heavy) 16 days ago; opening mark fair; player despite ground query
runners.spotlight: Best qualifying run when close second here (5f, heavy) 16 days ago; opening mark looks fair for this nursery debut and she's a player if not requiring testing conditions.

runners.name: Creciente
runners.comment: Weakened on nursery debut over 7f (good) 33 days ago; drop back in trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Respectable third in Windsor novice (6f) last month but weakened on her nursery debut over 7f (also good) 24 days later; drop back in trip could suit.

stable_tour.quote: She was bought to replace Crystal Casque and we always say she's got very big boots to fill, but she's had a good start and been placed a couple of times. She's got a handicap rating of 66 and will go to the next Newbury meeting for a nursery. She's a straightforward filly, easy to train, and hopefully she'll be as successful as the horse she replaced. 27-08-25

runners.name: Geemann
runners.comment: Big improvement when 6th (C&D, soft) 27 days ago; h'cap debut; player despite ground query
runners.spotlight: Big jolt of improvement when sixth of 11 in C&D (soft) maiden four weeks ago; well treated on that and he's a contender if slow ground isn't essential; handicap debut.

runners.name: Jane Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Inauspicious nursery debut when tongue tied and last (7f, AW) 8 days ago; drops in trip
runners.spotlight: Best run when chasing home Eclipser at Chelmsford (6f) in June; inauspicious nursery debut when tongue tied and last of eight over 7f at Wolverhampton (also AW) eight days ago; question to answer back down in trip.

runners.name: Filly Foden
runners.comment: 0-7 but some fair efforts along the way and she's edging down the weights; a possible
runners.spotlight: Yet to win in seven outings but there have been some fair efforts along the way, including when runner-up on her first two starts (5f, good); hasn't been progressing in nurseries but edging down the weights.

runners.name: Walk On Walk On
runners.comment: Not progressing but respectable 4th in nursery (6f, soft) 15 days ago; could get involved
runners.spotlight: Not really progressing but he went off favourite and it was a respectable fourth of 11 in Thirsk nursery (6f, soft) a fortnight ago; could get involved.

runners.name: Brightling
runners.comment: Made all twice in July; excuse latest; respected as one of only two winners in this field
runners.spotlight: Made all in four-runner event on nursery debut at Lingfield (6f) in July and repeated the trick in another small field at that track (5f, also good to soft) a fortnight later; couldn't dominate at Leicester next time but that was only eight days later and she's respected as one of just two previous winners in the field.

stable_tour.quote: We took advantage of a lenient handicap mark and she had four quick races in July for two wins and a second. We probably ran her a bit quick the fourth time and she's having a break now. She'll come back and have an autumn campaign on softer ground. Both her wins were with cut in the ground and when it was a bit faster she wasn't as good. 27-08-25

runners.name: Princess Billyboy
runners.comment: Denied room on h'cap debut (6f, AW) last month; might be capable of better
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress in three qualifying runs but it would be unfair to bash her nursery debut at Chelmsford (6f, AW) last month, when repeatedly denied room; might be capable of better.

runners.name: Reality Queen
runners.comment: Nothing to shout about in qualifying runs (all 6f); opening mark isn't heaven sent
runners.spotlight: Nothing to shout about in her qualifying runs (all 6f) and this opening mark doesn't look to be heaven sent.

runners.name: Red Snapper
runners.comment: Not disgraced on h'cap debut (5f, good) latest; cheekpieces go on; may still do better
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced despite finishing last of five on his handicap debut at Chepstow (5f, good) seven weeks ago; cheekpieces fitted and may be capable of better; first official start for Kathy Turner.

runners.name: Clipstone
runners.comment: Beat a total of one rival in two novices and a maiden (6f); mark doesn't look an open goal
runners.spotlight: Beat a total of one rival in two novices and a maiden (6f) and even this modest mark doesn't look an open goal; handicap debut.

runners.name: Mad Unicorn
runners.comment: Poor form to date and will need the switch to nurseries to spark plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: Green when beating one home on debut then raced freely when well held on her last two starts; will need the switch to nurseries to spark plenty of improvement.

runners.name: Addmann
runners.comment: Yet to beat a rival in three maidens (6f-1m) at huge prices; 4lb wrong for nursery debut
runners.spotlight: Yet to beat a rival in three maidens (6f-1m) at huge prices; 4lb out of the weights for this nursery debut.

race_name: Beatwright: Beat The Wright Way Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Hoornblower
runners.comment: Needs good step forward from heavy defeat when back from a break last time
runners.spotlight: Convincing win on AW fifteen months ago and might have been involved but for clipping heels at Salisbury (also 1m, good to firm) in June; heavy defeat over latter C&D when back from a break last time, though.

runners.name: King Of Speed
runners.comment: AW win in February and mainly continues in good form; respected
runners.spotlight: Placed in four of five runs here; mainly continues in good form although hasn't been able to add to his AW win (9.5f) in seven starts since February; still respected.

runners.name: Havana Mojito
runners.comment: Went back-to-back at Brighton (1m and 7f) in the spring but beaten 10l there last time
runners.spotlight: Went back-to-back at Brighton (1m and 7f) in the spring but in and out since, including when beaten about 10l there last time; others look more solid after that.

runners.name: Desert Footsteps
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs A E Pakenham
runners.comment: Made all (1m) last September; might have needed comeback; unexposed; heed market signals
runners.spotlight: Made all at Chepstow (1m, good; handicap debut) last September; absent after flopping at Brighton the following month until she reappeared with big defeat back there one month ago; quite possibly needed that and she's not fully exposed, however; heed any market signals.

runners.name: Thiscouldbefun
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore
runners.comment: C&D win (good to firm) in April; respectable third back here (heavy) 16 days ago; player
runners.spotlight: C&D winner (good to firm) in April who was refitted with cheekpieces when good second of 12 in 1m Windsor handicap (soft) at the start of this month; respectable third back here (heavy) 16 days ago; player.

stable_tour.quote: Coulsty has been doing well and has produced a couple of nice two-year-olds. She's got plenty of size and scope like most of mine. She's only a couple of weeks off a run. The jockeys who have ridden her absolutely love her but she'll be your seven-furlong type of horse. 04-07-24

runners.name: Ravenglass
runners.comment: Won in May; beaten less than 3l in AW handicap (also 7f) a fortnight ago; may have a say
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of five starts here (all 1m); won at Chepstow (good) in May and beaten less than 3l despite finishing seventh in AW handicap (also 7f) a fortnight ago; could make his presence felt.

runners.name: Latin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Has been favourite & 3rd three times for James Owen; likely comes good at some point
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden; third when favourite on first two starts for James Owen (9.5f and 1m), latterly in a visor, in May and also when back from a break at Wolverhampton (7f, also AW) ten days ago; fine on turf and he'll probably come good for this yard at some point.

runners.name: Baynoona
runners.owner: Miss Jane Edgar & D V Gardner
runners.comment: Off the mark at 14th attempt over C&D 17 days ago; very competitive after a 3lb nudge
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough at the 14th attempt when beating Eye Of The Water in a C&D handicap (good to soft) 17 days ago; had a bit to spare that day and should be very competitive after a 3lb nudge.

runners.name: Eye Of The Water
runners.comment: Two solid efforts over C&D (heavy/good to soft) this month and should go well again
runners.spotlight: Course regular who won his last two races over C&D, although they were in 2023; posted two solid efforts over C&D (heavy/good to soft) this month and battled on well for third at Ffos Las (7.5f, heavy) on Sunday; far from discounted if he's turned out again.

quotes.race: Rotherby Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything went wrong for Eye Of The Water at Wolverhampton last time but, although he's won at that track, he's a much better horse on soft ground. That's the key to him - Ron Harris, trainer.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Handicap
quotes.quote: Last time Eye Of The Water ran on soft ground at Ffos Las he won. Conditions were slightly heavier today and he relished them. He was able to get a smart break and he never saw another horse after that - David Probert, jockey.

runners.name: Letter Of The Law
runners.comment: Very hit-and-miss and his 2nd in July hasn't been reproduced in six subsequent starts
runners.spotlight: Very hit-and-miss these days and his second of 13 at Chepstow (good to firm) in July hasn't been reproduced in six subsequent starts; 1lb out of the weights and others look a lot safer.
